comments:
I am using latest dev build and got an NPE when started "New Repository Task" wizard. After selectng project (Mylar) on click Next. It is probably related to the fact that I didn't have user/password defined for choosen repository (most likely after moving to new Eclipse build).

Did it go away after you reset up your credentials?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Did it go away after you reset up your credentials?  

It did when I entered user and password for that repository

Great.  Will use this and similar failures to prompt people to ensure they entered their password.

Rob: we should add this to our manual test: i.e.
- Clear password, should prompt for credentials for the following:
  - Add new repository task
  - Refresh query

Created an attachment (id=34726)
Displays warning when invalid credentials discovered during new bug submission.

Ideally in the future we would like to redirect the user to the appropriate repository information dialog.

Created an attachment (id=34730)
Display warning when invalid credentials discovered upon bug submission and synchronization.

Patch applied.  Found one more place to do the check: before a submission of a new comment (or other change) on an existing report.  Currently this will bring up the HTML dialog which is not bad, but better to point people at the Task Repositories view.

Created an attachment (id=34802)
Fixed. Error dialog when submitting bug reports with invalid repository credentials

Patch includes updated manual test cases
Patch applied and verified.  This will make it much more obvious what's going on in the case of missing credentials.
